content.description: A long boulder starting low to the ground with some careful foot work and working around a beautiful mossy granite slope to a steep slightly overhung section, then back to a huge crack and finally topping out on granite slab. Careful where you place the mats for this one and make sure to wear long pants, unless you want to scrape your shins off.
content.protection: Be sure to bring multiple crash pads, as the climb involves substantial traversing
content.location: The start is on the east side of the boulder and involves standing up fully on 2 good feet and bringing the hands down to the lip of the rock and underclinging or pressing.

content.description: A shady glacial deposit of granite erratics. Just a few minutes from the parking lot for the south beach of Lake Willoughby - beautiful views of the lake in fall and spring.
